ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend taking this class to pass the comps.
Good introduction to graduate level economics class.Yes I would.
Recommended. It is essential to the further study of economics.
well it's a core course. if you're an economics ph.d student, you can never escape from it.
The course was not what I expected. It requires a lot more intuition than I thought and if you lack intuition, the course will be hard and sometimes even unpleasant.
This course must be attended by all the students who seek for Ph.D. If the materials are easier, I would recommend all the students who want to learn economics.
I will recommend this course to another student.
Yes, standard course in Economics and useful.
Yes, it is comprehensive, and it lays the foundation for further analysis.
Overall, I learn a lot from this course. I would recommend it.
The first half is an introduction to ways of thinking about consumer theory and producer theory. The second half focuses on different ways of determining equilibria.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It shows me the basic ideas behind microeconomics, and how this could be applied to many other subfields.
It simply enhanced my fundamental knowledge and skills of economics.
well i learned the minimum required for the research in this field.I couldn't feel much connection with recent research topic.i hope things would get better in next semester!
I learned very much but the extent to which the course will help me in the future is still unclear for me.
This course make me understand theories I always using deeper. And deeper understanding of theories will allow me to apply these theories to my work more precisely.
